page.title: 02Livestock:numbers and types
page.content: Twelve horses are trained as {steeplechasers}by a licensed trainer at The Farm, in stables adjoining the house, where Mr. Price the tenant farmer lives. This amalgamated 330 acre farm is rented from Mercantile and General Assurance Company. 58 acres are under {wheat,} 32{barley}and the rest ley {grass}for 200{lambs}fattened from December to March and{cattle}bought from Dorset. Some 260 Hereford/Friesian cattle sell to an abattoir in the Forest of Dean at 15-18 months old. 40 Friesian steers are fattened intensively under cover as a barley-beef unit for 12 months: bought at Â£90 each, they sell at Â£440, encouraged by subsidies. The land has been improved using heringbone clay pipe{drainage}systems which has increased yields by 10-15%.
